title: CHICKEN ENCHILADAS
directions: Microwave onion, 2 tbsp (30 mL) oil, chili powder, garlic, coriander and cumin in bowl, stirring occasionally, until onions are softened, about 5 minutes; transfer to slow cooker.
Stir in tomato sauce and sugar. Season chicken with pepper and nestle into slow cooker. Cover and cook until chicken is tender, 4-5 hours on low.

Transfer chicken to cutting board, let cool slightly, then shred into bite-size pieces using 2 forks. Combine chicken, 3/4 cup (180 mL) sauce, 1-1/2 cups (375 mL) Monterey Jack, cilantro, jalapenos and lime juice in bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 450 F (230 C). Spread 3/4 cup (180 mL) sauce over bottom of 13-by-9-inch (33-by-22-cm) baking dish.
Brush both sides of tortillas with remaining 2 tbsp (30 mL) oil. Stack tortillas, wrap in damp dish towel, and place on plate; microwave until warm and pli­able, about 1 minute.

Using 1 warm tortilla at a time, spread 1/3 cup (80 mL) chicken filling across centre of tortilla. Roll tortilla tightly around filling and place seam side down in bak­ing dish; arrange enchiladas in 2 columns across width of dish. 7 Pour remaining sauce over enchiladas to cover completely and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup (125 mL) Monterey Jack:
Cover dish with greased alu­minum foil. Bake until enchi­ladas are heated through and cheese melted, 15-20 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes before serving.
ingredients: a 11b (454 g) boneless, skinless chicken thighs, trimmed
8 oz (226 g) Monterey Jack cheese, shredded (2 cups/ 500 mL)
